Class BottomBlock

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class BottomBlock
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Specialized JPanel used by the Mortgage Manager
    Author:
    Miguel Salazar
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • asb

        java.util.ArrayList<AddSubButton> asb

      • buttonListen

        java.awt.event.ActionListener buttonListen
        Listener to all AddSubButtons in ArrayList of AddSubButtons asb for both AddSubButton's operator and id contained within the AddSubButton's ActionCommand. Calls the appropriate command: adding(String) or subtracting(String)

    • Constructor Detail

      • BottomBlock

        public BottomBlock(Suit s)
        Default constructor, passes only the current Suit object to modify
        Parameters:
        s - Suit object selected by the jcb JComboBox object in TopBlock

      • BottomBlock

        public BottomBlock(Suit s,
                   boolean so)
        Special case constructor, used if only downgrades are allowed
        Parameters:
        s - Suit object selected by the jcb JComboBox object in TopBlock
        so - boolean primitive, when true, properties can only be downgraded

    • Method Detail

      • fullUpdate

        public void fullUpdate()
        Updates all panels within BottomBlock fully and completely and stores new values to be used for the properties

      • setupBotBlock

        public void setupBotBlock()
        Calls for the defining of children components and adds them when complete

      • setUpPanelA

        public void setUpPanelA()
        Defines west JPanel and adds component JTextAreas Does NOT set Strings for component JTextAreas
        See Also:
        updatePanelA()

      • updatePanelA

        public void updatePanelA()
        Sets JTextArea components for west JPanel if the suit only contains 2 properties, the bottom-most JTextArea will be set to a blank String

      • setUpPanelB

        public void setUpPanelB()
        Defines center JPanel and adds component JTextAreas Does NOT set Strings for component JTextAreas
        See Also:
        updatePanelB()

      • updatePanelB

        public void updatePanelB()
        Sets JTextArea components for center JPanel If the suit only contains 2 properties, the bottom-most JTextArea will be set to a blank String

      • setUpPanelC

        public void setUpPanelC()
        Defines panelC children components including children panels and children buttons. Does NOT update AddSubButton tool tips Does NOT enable or disable buttons
        See Also:
        updatePanelC(), buttonEnabler()

      • updatePanelC

        public void updatePanelC()
        Sets tool tips for AddSubButtons in asb ArrayList of AddSubButton objects Does NOT enable or disable buttons
        See Also:
        buttonEnabler()

      • buttonEnabler

        public void buttonEnabler()
        Determines which AddSubButtons from ArrayList AddSubButton objects asb to enable and disable. By default, all AddSubButtons are enabled and then disabled if the disabling criteria are met

      • adding

        public void adding(java.lang.String command)
        Go between method for adding(int). This method takes a String command containing only the int portion of an AddSubButton's ActionCommand
        Parameters:
        command - String containing only the number portion of an AddSubButton's ActionCommand - converted to an int within the method
        See Also:
        adding(int)

      • adding

        public void adding(int id)
        Adds 1 to the stored int[] propGrades at the given index id. Later calls updatePanelB to change accordingly
        Parameters:
        id - int containing only the number portion of an AddSubButton's ActionCommand

      • subtracting

        public void subtracting(java.lang.String command)
        Go between method for subtracting(int). This method takes a String command containing only the int portion of an AddSubButton's ActionCommand
        Parameters:
        command - String containing only the number portion of an AddSubButton's ActionCommand - converted to an int within the method
        See Also:
        subtracting(int)

      • subtracting

        public void subtracting(int id)
        Subtracts 1 to the stored int[] propGrades at the given index id. Later calls updatePanelB to change accordingly
        Parameters:
        id - int containing only the number portion of an AddSubButton's ActionCommand

      • isChanged

        public boolean isChanged()
        Calls setChanged() and returns updated changed boolean.
        Returns:
        changed a boolean: true means the listing has been changed

      • setChanged

        public void setChanged()
        Determines if unsaved changes have been made to the current listing. Variables cannot be passed through to prevent cheating.

      • setSuit

        public void setSuit(Suit s)
        Sets the current Suit stored by the BottomBlock object
        Parameters:
        s - a Suit object stored as the updated listing

      • getSuit

        public Suit getSuit()
        Get method for the currently saved Suit object
        Returns:
        savedS a Suit object, the currently stored Suit object saved by the BottomBlock

      • getPropGrades

        public int[] getPropGrades()
        Get method to return the int[] propGrades which store the data utilized by panelB's children components. int[] order follows panelB's NORTH to SOUTH order
        Returns:
        propGrades an int[] containing the values utilized by panelB's children components

      • getASB

        public java.util.ArrayList<AddSubButton> getASB()
        Get method for ArrayList AddSubButton objects asb which contains all the buttons utilized in panelC
        Returns:
        asb an ArrayList of AddSubButtons containing all AddSubButton objects utilized in panelC
